docs.title: olly.gg
docs.text:
This site is mostly a collection of personal notes, things I’ve learned, things I’m exploring, and things I don’t want to forget.

I’m sharing them in case they help someone else who’s on a similar path. No promises of correctness, completeness, or polish though, be warned.

docs.title: Threat Intel AI Adventures
docs.text:
Using a custom Python RAG script, Ollama and Qdrant to ingest then spit out some contextualised responses to simple queries.

Over the past few sessions, I built a fully local, zero-cost threat-intelligence assistant using open-source tooling. The system combines Ollama for embeddings and language models with Qdrant as a high-performance vector store, allowing natural-language search across cyber-threat documents. It supports ingestion, chunking, semantic search, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), all running entirely in my homelab environment.

The result is a lightweight but powerful threat-intel capability: I can query APT groups, TTPs, malware behaviour, and other security topics and get context-aware answers grounded in my own corpus of reports. Everything runs offline, uses free tooling, and is fully under my control. A practical foundation for an AI-assisted SOC workflow, CTI analysis, or automated threat-hunting assistant.

I don't expect to get these to a highly functional (or stable) standard, but more understand the concepts and integration opportunities.
